message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.DB. 

The paper presents a randomized approach for topic mining from large-scale corpora, which involves generating random partitions of the corpus vocabulary based on term co-occurrence and agglomerating highly overlapping inter-partition cells to produce the mined topics. This approach is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including Information Retrieval (cs.IR) for its focus on mining topics from large-scale corpora, Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) for its use of natural language processing techniques, Machine Learning (cs.LG) for its use of randomized algorithms, Data Structures (cs.DS) for its use of hash-based data structures, and Databases (cs.DB) for its focus on efficient data processing.
